Definition: Vertical parent–child caregiving and authority relationship (including adoptive parents).
Typical Narrative Context: Stepmother abuse; king expels prince; mother saves child.

Definition: Horizontal sibling relationship by blood or sworn kinship; often includes rivalry.
Typical Narrative Context: Brothers split the household; sister protects younger sister; Cain and Abel.

Definition: A legally or customarily recognized long-term partner (contractual).
Typical Narrative Context: Searching for a missing wife; queen betrays king.
Uncle as guardian or villain; grandmother offers guidance.

Definition: Lovers/partners driven by passion or courtship outside marriage (including affairs).
Typical Narrative Context: Romeo and Juliet; knight courts a noble lady; first love.
Minister remonstrates; king delivers judgment; knight swears fealty.

Definition: Master–servant/employer relationship based on personal dependence
column6: Landlord and hired hand; genie and Aladdin; lord and butler.

Definition: Mentor–student relationship based on transmission of knowledge/skills/wisdom.
Typical Narrative Context: Wizard trains apprentice; martial-arts master passes down techniques; sage points the way.
General orders soldiers; bandit chief directs henchmen.

Definition: Close friends based on personal affection with no direct instrumental motive.

column5: Two rival kingdoms ally to slay a dragon; temporary party forms to seek treasure.

Definition: Peers in the same profession or fellow disciples (non-blood).
Typical Narrative Context: Guards on the same post; competing senior disciples in one sect.

Definition: Mortal enemies driven by hatred/destruction; goal is to eliminate the other.
Typical Narrative Context: Hero vs demon lord; vengeance for a slain father; good vs evil.

column5: Bragging contest rivals; two knights courting the same person.
